abstract: An online questionnaire from Sanford C. Bernstein & Company found that A.I.G. investors wanted the insurer to sell or spin off businesses to better focus its operation.
snippet: An online questionnaire from Sanford C. Bernstein & Company found that A.I.G. investors wanted the insurer to sell or spin off businesses to better focus its operation.
lead_paragraph: If the American International Group’s chief executive, Peter D. Hancock, was planning to essentially maintain the status quo at the insurer, he should probably expect resistance from investors.

headline.main: A.I.G. Investors Unhappy With Insurer’s Strategy, Advisory Firm Says
